The room and bathroom were pretty much clean but, they do have this odor to them (smells like cigarettes even though it's a non-smoking room).    3. Rooms, although spacious and big, is very dark (same with the bathroom).    4. Parking is in the back (easily missed if you're driving on Sunset) so slowdown as it is a one-way driveway to get to the back parking lot (the pathway is to the left of the inn). The lot is small though. If you actually are in a spot, and have to leave early the next day, be prepared to be blocked in. I once had to leave early (around 4:30am) and I had to play tetris and move two cars around to unblock my car to be able to leave (FrontDesk personnel did not know how to drive so I had to do it myself, which I didn't mind). He was around to help guide me move the cars. Fortunately, I didn't park too far in into the lot (otherwise, it would have been tricky trying to get all those cars out to get my car out of the lot).    5. Check out Leo's Taco Truck, literally within feet of the hotel, in the parking lot at Western/Sunset. Oh, there's always a Walgreens next door, Food 4 Less across the street, McDonalds, and a bunch of eateries nearby and within walking distance.    6. Wifi is free and I didn't have any issues with it.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: You can‚Äôt beat this deal, clean room extremely reasonable rate. This is my spot when I come to Hollywood. It has a great location. Never any problems or noises as it‚Äôs on a very busy street. I‚Äôll be back again and again.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: great location, great price, but minimal ammenities
column11: the room we had was a king bed room. it was very roomy and everything was clean and working. there was a sheet over the couch, which was a little weird, and no blanket on the bed, only a sheet. it was quiet for being on sunset blvd, which was nice. it was advertised that there was a breakfast included, but there is none, just coffee next to the check in window. parking lot is super tiny and fills up. there's more rooms than parking spots, but there is some close street parking.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: Great location Great price Great service
column11: We had an event at another location and chose to stay here due to budget- We were SO impressed with the cleanliness, kindness and upgrades within the room- Price is perfect-location is great! Coffee just down the street- best taco truck ever on the corner! (We ate there every night!) Easy to get to everything- grocery store across the street- room was nice and clean and newly remodeled- bed was super comfortable and shower was hot! I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: If you‚Äôre looking for a simple place to sleep, shower, and a good location that‚Äôs in the heart of Hollywood then I would recommend this place. Its great for its price, nothing flashy. Maybe they forgot to vacuum that part of the floor but other than that, I enjoyed my stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: If all you are needing is a room this is perfect. There is no breakfast at this location but there is fresh coffee in there small lobby. Getting a LYFT or UBER was pretty easy. They have a very small parking lot in the back. There is a film school next door and my son tells me the film here quite often so don't let that put you off if all you are wanting is a room. There is no view. I did not have expectations but it was perfect for what i needed.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We liked the solid floors (no carpet), the cleanliness, wish the hallway door had been secured by key entry only. The TV is small but works. The shower is small but works. The bed is comfortable. The lights work.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I mean, its hard to cram into such a small space. First, parking is a joke. You get "free" parking if you are there early enough to get a space. Secondly, you need to pray there is no one leaving or blocking the only way in or out of the parking lot. The driveway is barley wide enough to accommodate a full size pick up truck. Then they want to give me the option of being the one who will have to be called to move their vehicle at night if someone needs to get in, like i choose the exit aisle on the plane or something. smh So i ask to look at my room before i check in. I turn right around and head right out the door. PLEASE DONT BELIEVE THE PHOTOS!! This is every bit a one star location generously. The neighborhood is NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY AT ALL!!! Be careful and stay safe. Do not let your guard down if you choose to stay whether inside or out. I am from the south side of Chicago and believe me when I say BE CAREFUL!!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: Not bad but nothing to rave about
column11: I realise you're paying for location with this accommodation, so I wasn't expecting much but the room was clean and quite spacious. Very outdated, and the room could do with a fresh coat of pain, new pillows which look like they're about ten years old and sheets that don't have stains. The right size sheets for the bed would also be nice, The towels were very small and quite rough but I guess you get what you pay for.    Air conditioner worked well and I liked the big white louvred windows.    If you're on a budget then this property would be ok for a night or two.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: You get what you pay for
column11: The location is incredible! We stayed 4 nights. 2 nights were great, 2 were horrible. The room was large and free of bugs or anything like that. The floor was very very dirty, but it was not carpeted,so it felt less gross. Just don't walk around barefoot or in socks. The beds were very firm. Sheets were clean. Air conditioner worked great! Refrigerator was large and clean and worked well. The walls are paper thin. 2 nights(Tuesday and Wednesday), that was fine as it was reasonably quiet. However, 2 nights (Sunday and Monday) were miserable because of people being extremely loud in the hallway and in surrounding rooms and someone smoking in the alley and the smoke coming through the AC into the room. The free parking was very much appreciated, but tricky to navigate. Only one night we had to block someone in when we parked and were called to move in the morning, which really wasn't a problem at all. The price was amazing. I would recommend if you just need a place to sleep and want the cheapest place in the best location.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I had a graet time there. The staff was super nice when I called them on the phone prior to my arrival, and allowed me to pay for my full stay in cash, which was convenient for me. Room was very clean, had a refrigerator and lots of space. The internet was a little slow sometimes, but that's ok, as it worked well most of the time. Location is just fantastic, very close to the metro station, right in front of mcdonald's and a block away from gamestop and starbucks. Definitely worth the price

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Cozy & comfortable place. Close to downtown Hollywood. Limited parking though, check for availably. Easy access to nearby food shops and immediate to the freeway. Enjoyed stay here and would come back for another trip.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We were very happy with our 2 night stay. Very affordable for the location. The room was quite large, bathroom had a hairdryer, bed was firm but comfortable. The hotel is next to a Walgreens, McDonalds and a grocery store. There was a fridge in room. Wifi was incl. and reliable. The parking is free. Only a 10 min drive to Griffiths park/Hollywood sign! The only real negative about this hotel is that the bedding is paper thin. We had to have the heat on and it was very loud. Be sure to pack earplugs.    We woke up really early on our first day (still on eastern time), and our car was blocked in by other guests. We decided to change our plans (otherwise the concierge would have had to wake up the guests to move their cars) and walk to Hollywood blvd. It took about 40 mins but was totally doable. If you have to be out early, consider parking strategically. We had no issues the next morning though. Farmer Guys is a great place for breakfast or lunch, just up Western Rd. Larchmont village is also nearby and worth checking out.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We had a very nice room, very accessible which was extremely important being that I am in a wheelchair, the bed was really comfortable, and the staff was very accommodating. The only down side is the walls looked pretty beat up.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Fantastic Price.  Great Location.  Comfortable Accommodations.  Friendly Staff.  AC/Heat.  Large Rooms.  Recently Renovated.  Spacious Bathrooms.  Free Parking.  No Hidden Fees.  Refrigerators in Rooms.  Flat-screen TVs.    Book it now.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Room was clean and large. Could not hear other guests, however the sirens of Emergency vehicles were very loud and annoying all night. Front desk employee was pleasant and the free parking was a plus.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Great location. Near metro, food store and restaurants. Hotel not fancy but simple and clean. The room was large. The staff was nice and helpful. The bath products could be better. Did not care for them at all.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We stayed in this otel 2 nights. The location was totally great. You can reach Kodak theatre after 15 min. walk. The room was clean and nice. Staff was nice to us. The price is good for quality. the location was also looking safe. We liked it!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We stayed for 3 nights (couldn't have gone quicker) and paid around $380 as we couldn't find anywhere cheaper to stay last minute.    Only had one chat with the staff seemed nice enough checking in so can't fault that.    Now I'm not a fussy person at all, a rooms a room and we needed somewhere to stay in LA whilst passing through. But this particular room we were given absolutely stank when the A/C came on as if it had a dead animal inside (I've seen other reviews with similar mentions to the smell) so we left it off.    The other major problem for us was the blood. The curtain had a splat of dried blood on along with the base of the bed. I don't like to cause a fuss and had no where else to stay but this was a major put off from the start.    The other problem is the security of the place, no safe in the room. Front and rear door open all night so anybody can walk through the hotel at any time (we got the gist it was quite a rough neighbourhood with a lot of homeless people sleep around nearby).    The walls were very thin you could hear all close rooms conversations and had to whisper for privacy.    Leaving a terrible review as I wouldn't recommend anybody staying there and would happily pay double the price in the future to stay anywhere half as bad.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Nice, clean, quiet and good price. We arrived very fast, cause it is in good location. A lot of business are around of the hotel that permited us to dine and buy things that we needed it. Also we could go to hollywood right away because is very near to that important location.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Parking too small for all guests; smelly rooms (probably used chemical deodorizers); morning coffee was there probably at 7 am, but not later; no coffee maker in the room; homeless people sleeping in the streets around the hotel.  Good side: if you like Thai food, there are probably 20 or more Thai restaurants within walking distance; liquor store across the street; great Armenian bakery next door with delicious and inexpensive pastries.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: The hotel is located near hollywood Blvd. 15 minute walk to hollywood (Dolby theatre). There is a Walgreens besidethe hotel and there are a lot of places to eat. The rooms are big and clean. The service is great.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I don't usually do this but...Worst hotel ever. It is cheap but only because it is not worth more. Smells sooooo bad. Rooms are smelly and filthy! Old, outdated, filthy. Our curtain had blood stains (could not have been anything else). It was late after a 400 mile drive and nothing much in our price range was available so we had to stay. We slept in our clothes. There is a Walgreens next door so we purchased disinfectant wipes and Lysol to clean the surfaces we had to touch. Oh and we were given a smoking room by mistake and the front desk would not change it. If you can stay away from it. Oh and Western/Sunset is NOT a good area to be.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: If you are not looking for some fancy hotel, you can survive in here. At least it is a clean place, with a big and comfort bed, cleaning bathroom with clean towels.  There is no breakfast service, and the recepcionists aren¬¥t the most nice people in the world. Don¬¥t count on them to help you with some tips about the neighborhood.  The neighborhood is great, with a walgreens next to the hotel, near from subway station and tons of bus stops.  I¬¥d stay there again.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: You get what you pay for
column11: We stayed here for 4 nights, and it was not the location we wanted. But that`s only our fault that we didn`t research better. The motel was only 10-20 minutes walk to walk of fame, and there was a lot of good restaurants neraby. The motel was ok, but it was not that clean - dirty carpet and bathroom, and it was much noise from other guests!! We paid approx. 210 dollars for 4 nights, so that`s not expensive.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Booked this hotel to myself and family and ended up disappointing. Everything smelt smoke. There were cigarette burns on bed and mold on carpet. There were lipstick marks on my brother's pillowcase. Unfortunately my brother had to re book another hotel in LA and didn't even get a refund. I really regret booking this hotel. This motel pretty much ruined my stay in Hollywood. Only good point is location is convenient for everything such as restaurants and supermarkets. You will mostly find Asian restaurants like Thai and Chinese. Still I would not recommend this place to anyone.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We spend 6 days at Hollywood stars inn. The hotel is located 10 minutes walk from Hollywood Blvd. you have grocery stores and restaurants just around the corner. The restaurants are mostly Thai food, but it's very good. The beds and sheets are clean, but the carpet on the floors, we're so dirty that we had to wear shoes all the time, or else our feet would get black. The bathroom was okay. The AC worked, but was not the best.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: No one was trying to fix the light in my bathroom although I reported to the reception several times. I had to show in darkness during my whole stay. They don't really care about the customers. Also, no information is provided during my checked in besides giving me the key, I had to asked everything including the wifi password. Although it is said that breakfast is included, I didn't see any food or drink during my stay.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: No frills. Clean, specious, air con was effective.    Bathroom did everything it needed. Bit stained but clean.    Some noise from road\other guests but nit too bad.    Staff friendly and helpfull. Let us leave our bags after check out.    Only stayed one night but would stay again.    Well placed for long walk or short taxi to mist Hollywood attractions.    IMPORTANT- remember to dead bolt your door!! And keep valuables out of sight!    It does say this on the key card but we didnt read it till too late.    The doors do not lock properly unless you lock the sad bolt!!!  We had cash taken from walets and some jewlery taken in the night. Themanager did not seem at all surprised.  It was our own fault for not locking up properly.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: What can I say besides, "oh my"! My plan was to spend one night there to prevent a long drive home since I had to be back in the area the following morning. The office is behind bulletproof glass, and the office attendant comes from behind a rod iron gate. The room has furniture that must be at least 20years old. I sat on the bed which also felt like it was 20 years old as it was lumpy. I pulled down the sheets and found a long black hair on the sheets under the bedspread. I asked for my money back, they said no. I said bye Felicia and drove home.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Booked this hotel because the app said it had a pool, Wi-Fi and breakfast. It had none of those. The Wi-Fi gets changed daily, without being told the New log in. No breakfast whatsoever, and no swimming pool. This made me very sad.  Otherwise hotel is good for location and price..

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: This hotel should be on the reality show Hotel Nightmares
column11: My husband and I chose this place as it was listed as a "hotel" (it is more of a hostel) supposedly walking distance from Universal Studios (this a lie)    The area where this place is located is quite run down and we did not feel comfortable walking around the area.    On our second night the guests next door decided to play music all night long. The staff were aware and did not make any attempt to get them to turn it down. It was like been at a festival. I will be seeking a refund for that night.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: The room carpet was so disgusting of you walked barefoot on it you'll end up with black feet!!  The doors to enter the hotel were wide open 24/7 and the area didn't look safe. I had to put my suitcase against the door at night to make sure no one tried to break in as there was a guy outside who asked my name and 1h later the staff gave him my room number and he called in my room to know if he can come to have a drink.... Good thing about the suitcase against the door, during my last night at about 4am I heard a loud noise, woke up and heard some drunk dude outside, he might have got the wrong room, I don't know but he banged so hard on the door that the lock fell on the floor!  Housekeeping came everyday but the room was always dirty, Specially the carpet and the bathroom.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: Ok for prices, would stay again for location and close shops within walking distance
column11: Stayed here for 11 nights in total, checked in, smelt strong smell of curry at reception, was a solo traveller and was given room 101 right at the front of the hotel opposite the reception desk on ground floor which had 1 king size bed in, this was extremely noisy as could hear all the traffic and people talking to reception so asked to be moved, was moved to room 115 also on ground floor, this was at the back of the hotel so was a lot quieter and had 2 dbl beds in and a disabled access shower, 7 days in and suddenly I flush my toilet and sewerage started coming up the drain in the middle of the bathroom floor, got moved to room 114 opposite which also had two dbl beds in and was nicer IMO although the heater kept making a funny beeping sound, 1 night later the manager Ash asked me to please move to room 110 as he had only put me in room 114 as an emergency because of the plumbing issue and apprentice that room was booked now from today, so I moved for a third time to room 110 which had 1 King size bed in and an ok bath/shower. Stayed here for a further 3 nights, then on day of check out I asked if I could be given FREE late check out until 4pm because of all the trouble I'd had and I was supposed to be resting as had an operation, was told it would not be free and i could pay $20 cash instead on another room night charge. So payed.  Location is good for food places, there's a McD's & a 24hr Food4less opposite, then just to the left there's a big shoe shop warehouse place selling Timberland,Nike etc, Walgreens pharmacy next door and also a Burger King, subway, panda (Chinese) and some other food places up the road, if you don't drive then this is good for walking distance to food places. Reception people are very helpful though as even heated my food up in their microwave one night for me as it was cold, this hotel could be made better my installing a kitchenette in the rooms.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: This hotel was quite surprising in a good way! Arriving early morning straight from the airport after a 15hr flight, the hotel staff allowed us to check in a few hours earlier (albeit reluctantly). The room itself was massive and quite clean. The TV had a lot of stations, unfortunately some of the buttons on the remote didn't work but since we didn't come to watch TV it didn't matter. It really is a short walk to the train station which was perfect for us. And a short walk to a supermarket, McDonalds & other shops (Ross's for e.g). Was a very convenient location for our needs

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: The rooms were quite large and they seemed clean enough. For the location you can't beat the price here. However the parking situation is terrible.    The lot in the back is very small and once it's full the staff apparently allows a few cars to be parked in the "middle" of the lot. When I went to check in and inquire where to leave my car another guest came up and asked how to get his car out since he was literally blocked in. The guy working the desk repeatedly asked the guest if he could move the blocking car himself since he didn't have a license. Apparently the front desk asks for some guests to surrender their car keys?    After seeing that, I decided to park right in front of the hotel on the street. It's metered but if you move your car early enough in the morning you're fine.    If you do stay here, don't give up your car keys because apparently there's a chance anyone else staying at the hotel may be asked to "move your car" without your knowledge.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Probably one of the worst hotels I stayed in. It is not actually a hotel, it is supposed to be a motel but it felt like a hostel.    PROS: good location, 3 blocks away from the metro station, in front there is a McDonalds, next to Walgreens, Starbucks, near a CVS Pharmacy. Around an hour (walking) away from the Walk of Fame. Reasonable price. Spacious bedroom. Clean bathroom.    CON: oh boy. 1) the front desk. They have a separate window glass so there is a barrier when you try to show them/talk to them. Not a personalized attention. 2) the first night we had to call them because our TV wasn't working. The receptionist couldn't helped us, so his advice was "please keep trying until it works" (???). Then it turned out, the heating wasn't working. Again I had to call them (never in my life I had to bother the front desk twice in a row). At least THAT he could fix. 3) the smell. In the hallways it was like we got into an Indian restaurant; the smell was so strong, and what it is weird, they do not even have a restaurant in the hotel. Inside the room, the smell was different, something similar to cigarettes, and even nastier, if possible. 4) Our 2nd day there, when we came back, our bed wasn't done and all our trash cans were still full of papers. Turns out, you have to put the message of "clean please" outside your door if you want the maids to clean your room. 5) when we wanted to book a shuttle, this hotel was not on the list. We had to chose a hotel that was 2 blocks from there so the shuttle could pick up us from there. Not exactly a "con", but just in case you want to avoid any hassles.    I was going to add that there are a lot of homeless people around there, but truth is, homeless people are everywhere in LA.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: Resonable price, good for the carless
column11: Ecoomical and very comfortable. Huge room with clean and generous linens, with the little amenties (soap and shampoo) provided, and a 24 hour Wallgreens only steps away if you've forgotten anything. Busses right outside, and the train station is a short walk up the road or a bus stop if you're like me and sometimes limited on mobility. It's not high end, nor is the neighborhood but even as a solo female traveler I felt safe.  I'd stay here again without hesitation.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Where do I begin!? Pulling up I missed the turn due to it being as wide as a vehicle! As I came back around and pulled in, luckily, no car was pulling out as it is a One way in, One way out. I get to the back of the building to see a parking lot fit for your house. If a spot wasn't open when I pulled up, I wouldn't know where to park. I check in - no problem. My Girlfriend and I get ready for the night and head to Universal Studios for Horror Night. We return at about 315am to find the parking lot ABSOULTELY FULL, with 2 cars NOT parked in spaces and blocking in 4 cars! So I finally manage to do a 360 with the little space that was given & back to Sunset Blvd I go to look for parking who knows where.. I drive next door to Walgreens to ask if I may park there due to My hotels lack of parking. No luck. I proceed to ask Food4Less directly across the street because they have a security guard & a gate around the lot. I found luck there but was asked to return at 9am to move it. As I am walking into the hotel I see the front desk attendent so i raise concern. I ask him why I wasn't informed about this LIMITED PARKING in the back, he didnt know what to say but "you can park back there, leave your keys with me & I will move it if its a problem." I told him, "I didnt even give you permission to drive my car, do you really think someone would leave a $60,000 set of keys with you?" He was speechless & had no resolution for where I should park.. When i woke up at 9, no spaces in the back of my hotel became available so i had to ask for more time at Food4Less, lucky once again - till 12pm. As I am walking back into my hotel I come across the woman owner! I raised concern - this lady wanted to compare me driving around looking for a parking space to her driving around LAX looking for a spot and her looking for a spot in a restaurant parking lot. She had no concern for me parking my vehicle across the street NOT on hotel premises where I should have been parked since they ask for your license plate # & your make & model. She told me it wasn't her problem that I didnt inform them that I would be arriving IN A VEHICLE! Telling me, "I don't know if you come on bus, walk, drive, taxi, I don't know." I said that shouldn't matter you should have enough parking for all rooms, how many rooms are here?" She says "25." There is about 8-10 spaces to park in. This hotel is so unfit for its guests I recommend YOU DO NOT STAY HERE!!!  Also a problem throughout my stay was the noise in the building, doors slamming, people running up & down the hall. People yelling at one another, random noises throughout the night & NO ICE MACHINE!!! The fridge in the room didnt keep my beer cold & the bathroom fan didnt work as it started to smell like smoke, I am assuming from the above room.. the TV was in an awkward place, the bed spread had cigarette burns in it as I am in a SMOKE FREE room..  People DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We, my 2 daughters, wife and I stayed for a total of 10 nights through September. It's not flash, just clean, very comfortable, large room, good bed for a good night's sleep and everything works. The family that run the hotel are very helpful and pleasant too. We had a total of 10 nights in LA and ended up staying here all 10 nights.  The location is very convenient: Metro station (Hollywood/Western) 5-10 minutes walk, bus stops just out front on Sunset Blvd to head west to Beverly Hills or east to downtown and also to head down Western to Koreatown. There's a Food for Less just across the road for groceries, plenty of Thai restaurants nearby and also all the popular names like Subway, Starbucks, McDonalds and 7-11 are close.  After a full day out we found it like a home away from to home to come back to our room.  The carpark is tight but Ash, the manager, has it worked out with fitting everyone's car in and letting people out.  If you're looking for a comfortable place to stay on a budget and in a good location then this just may be the place for you.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I stayed there last week. The room was huge, the bed was clean. The carpet? What i learnt is that you shouldn't walk barefoot on your bedroom carpet because you'll realize soon enough that it is truely disgusting, the sole of my feet were black and the carpet was stained everywhere. The bed sheet had cigarette holes all over it. During the day the area was alright, but walking around at night was pretty scary. There were a lot of homeless people, they were totally fine, but im talking about the people hanging out on the parking lot near of the hotel at night.. thankfully there is a Walgreen in between that is open all night. Anyone can enter the hotel at any time of day and night, it is absolutely not secure. I had the habit to put the nightstand in front of the door during the night because i didn't feel safe. On my last night there, at about 4am i heard a loud bang on my door. I opened the lights and saw that the lock on the door had felt on the floor. I have not seen who was there and banged on the door but anyway, i couldn't get back to sleep after that.  The housekeeper wasn't friendly but the staff at the reception was great and helpful.  I chose this hotel for its proximity with the Sunset Strip, as i knew i was going to hang out there most evening. For my next trip i would go back if i don't find anything else, but i'll definitely try to find a hotel in West Hollywood/Westwood as i feel a whole lot safer there.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We stayed at this inn due to the price/location and some of the trip advisor reviews.  We literally wanted somewhere clean, safe with parking that was cheap and close to everything and that is exactly what we got. I cannot understand the bad reviews for this hotel?! The room was massive, parking was fine and although not in a upmarket area the location was safe. You will get homeless in every city you go to however they don't bother you at all.  We borrowed a iron from the owner which was no trouble and although the room had no safe we left quite a lot of money in there and all was fine.  The beds where huge and comfortable. The shower hot and everything was fine. Would stay here again and I'm a very fussy person.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: I'd like to give this place a 1 but you pay for what you get
column11: I've never been more uncomfortable staying at a hotel (they can't room change you ever, 25 rm hotel, They could use an extra lock on the door)...however you get what you pay for....if every other hotel in that area is about $40 plus more a night there is a reason. My bed (holes in bed spread) and bathroom was clean during my stay, but can't say the rest of everything else in the room. The metro is super close to walk to, Walgreens right next door, an awesome food truck that was parked outside. I was barely in the room, thankfully but I had a good nights sleep. No rowdy people luckily! (Yes you can hear other rooms, and barely hear the ackwardly placed TV in your room).I'll never stay there again, but all employees I meet were nice , especially the young man on 8/09 (when I checked in). So I'll use this as a learning experience, if next time I pay more and feel like this, then I'll raise hell!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I really was thinking that this would be a nice room with looking at the pictures but no the room was horrible it smell really bad and the carpets was very dirty and the sheets had black spots on them too my daughters was gross out from the room and I didn't feel good about the carpets too cause I have a baby that is always on the floor for any one that thinks about getting this room cause of the Price don't do it it's not worth it and parking is so bad too the parking lot is very small so I had to park on the Street I would never go back here this place is gross and need to clean up was not happy with it at all .

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I booked this motel after reading great trip advisor reviews, so I was extremely disappointed to discover they were all a load of crap.  To start with there is no security on the building. Guests can check in 24hours a day and enter through an unsecured door - back or front of the building. This means ANYONE can waltz through the main walkway at any time of day or night. I felt extremely unsafe.  The desk is unmanned and you push a bell for staff to come our from a little room out the back.  We stayed in the room directly opposite check in for five nights and we got very little sleep the whole time. A tour group of very loud people rocked up at 11pm to check in one night and there was no concern for any of the guests who may have been sleeping. The next night, same thing at 10.30pm. I don't know maybe this is an LA thing..  Disappointing as our days were packed with sightseeing and theme parks.  Thin walls so you can hear absolutely everything from people going up and down the stairs, to screaming at each other down the hall andguests who think it's fine to play loud music and indulge in loud conversation until 4am in a small motel - mind you there was Zero courtesy from staff to put a stop to it even when we asked a number of times.  We booked a smoking room as it was all that was left, and it was fine, but honestly.... Cigarette burn stains on bathroom vanity?? Burn holes in the bed linen?? Come on. Lift your game!! There was dirty carpets and a toilet whose flush abilities were very unreliable.  We have been overseas staying in hotels/motels for nearly six months. This is the absolute worst place I have ever stayed in my life. I couldn't even apologise for saying I wouldn't even recommend it to my enemy. If I had booked through the hotel website instead of a third party website, I would be asking for every single cent back.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: An enjoyable stay at this hotel.  The room booked was a non smoking double sized room with two comfortable double beds. The room was great as a base, clean and complete with fridge, air con and a TV (with some decent stations like HBO, AMC and the usual networks). The wifi was great to begin with (they give you the password on checking in), but they changed provider during our stay, and was good but unfortunately wasn't as reliable as earlier.    Had minimal contact with staff, but any requests were dealt with promptly and with a minimal of fuss.    No meals, but there is complimentary coffee/tea from the check in desk area.    The location on W Sunset Blvd is great. The Hollywood Western Metro station is only a couple of blocks away, so great for getting around (only a couple of stops from Hollywood Blvd and Universal Studios). A Food4Less is across the road, ideal for stocking up the fridge. A pharmacy is also next door. There are plenty eateries along the road, from McDonalds, to a couple of Denny's and other diners. Enough to eat out differently each day of the week. And go far enough along Sunset Blvd and there is the chance to shop your socks off, with stores like Amoeba Music, Meltdown Comics, Staples, Home Depot and more.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Nice little hotel on Sunset, one block from Metro Station, very close to Hollywood walk of fame and all other attractions. Two metro stations to Man's Chinese Theater, 4 stations to Universal Studios. Very close to Griffith Park and Observatory. Hotel room was spacious and clean, room service every day. King size comfy bed. Free WiFi and coffee. Awesome taco food truck outside. Also right next to Walgreens.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Probably one of the most cheaper but still comfortable and clean. Obviously is not a 5 stars, we stayed 5 nights here and the room was clean and the bed comfortable. Close to the underground and some nice restaurant around there. For people who need a bed just for sleep it's worth.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Rooms were clean and spacious with working ac. Bed was comfortable and the hotel was located within a short walk from the metro, 2 stops from sites such as the Chinese theatre. The best thing about the hotel was the staff who went beyond their duty to make us welcome. They allowed me to check in early and use their personal cell phone.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Going here, I wasn't expecting much for the price but once I arrived I changed my mind. It's in a great location and the staff were always helpful. The hotel is only a five minute walk to/from the Hollywood/Western Metro subway station and is also close to bus stops. My room had a fridge and although a microwave would have been nice I lived without one. The wi-fi worked great.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I was pleasantly surprised. I was worried by some of the reviews but didn't need to be.  We arrived and were checked in quickly and easily with no problems. We were given wifi codes on arrival and directed to our room. It was room 214 on the 2nd floor at the end of the corridor. It was a smoking room which was all they had when I booked. I was worried it was gonna smell of smoke but it smelt clean and fresh. The room itself was of a decent size, with a large king size bed and an adequate bathroom.There were bed side tables and lamps on each side of the bed, a dressing table with mirror and chair, a dresser with 2 drawers, a small place to hang your clothes and a fridge in the room. There was also a heater/aircon.didn't need to use it so can't comment on it. Also there was a hair dryer which I didn't use.  Everything wirked as it should. The wifi was fast- I'm using it to write this review! There was plenty of hot water for showering and never ran out Water pressure was good and I enjoyed the showers. Soap and shampoo provided.Bathrown clean. The bath was tiny though! Fine as I didn't want a bath. There were some cigarette burns sounds the sink but never bothered me as it didn't impact the usage of the sink. Plenty of towels provided although they are very small!  The bed very comfortable. My partner and I slept well every night. The sheets were changed and were clean. The top blanket had a few small cigarette burns but again no concern to me. 3 comfortable pillows provided.  The fridge made occasional humming sounds in the night but this was ok. Didn't wake us and kept everything cold. Staff friendly although we had limited contact with them as all was fine.  Location excellent - 5 min walk from Hollywood/Western which links you to Hollywood Boulevard in 2 stops for Chinese theater, walk of fame etc. Also nearby, food 4 less across the road, wall greens next door, subway, McDonald's, 7/11 etc. There's also a taco truck outside.  Parking seemed adequate, we didn't use it though. There was about 9 slaves and when we got back at around 9pm there was always 1 or 2 spaces left although packed in the morning!  I highly recomend this hotel. It was fit for purpose and I would defiantly stay here again. The price was brilliant for the location.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We stayed at this hotel twice, in May 2014 and April 2015. Both times had a wonderful experience. You get what you pay for and more. Our rooms both times were really nice and clean: we had a king size bed (sheets perfectly clean and changed every day), a nice clean bathroom, a flat screen tv, a coat rack, a big mirror with a seat in front of it, a table with 2 chairs. Basically everything you need. The location is great, they have their own parking lot, and we never had issues with parking there. There is a taco truck parked on that street every night, so that works out great when you didn't have a chance to get dinner. My only suggestion is to have microwaves in the room. We will definitely stay at this hotel again when we visit Hollywood next time.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Had a nice stay. Parking was awful there is no free breakfast but you get what you paid for. we stayed 2 nights and enjoyed our stay. I read recommend taking a taxi to and from all the fun stuff unless you wanna walk 45 min to the Boulevard

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: This is one of the worst hotels i have ever stayed in. The carpets are filled with dark stains.I had to walk with shoes in the room. Very minimal facilities. No iron box, no microwave, torn bedsheets and blankets, tv did not work the first day but they fixed it the next day. No bathroom carpets.There are lot of beggars and homeless people around the hotel. The guy who sits at the from desk does not even greet you with a smile, Very greedy people. The only thing good about this place is its location. There is a metro station near by, just two stops from universal studios and close to griffith park. Please do not waste your money on this hotel. This is an advice from a honest man

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Beyond useless    It is unbelievable how little the owners of this motel know about the area, literally on their doorstep. We asked where to catch a bus from, which turned out to be just down the road, but they had no clue. Also, we tried to use the phone in the room, which you have to put a $5 deposit for, but it wouldn't work. The number we were dialling was definitely in use as they were able to ring it from reception, however the response was, you can't ring from here go back to your room and keep dialling until it works. But there was something clearly wrong with the phone, so we had to ring from a uk mobile instead which was really expensive! Rooms are pretty standard but nothing to shout about. However, if you don't have a car do not stay here. It is not in a nice area at all, around a 50 minute walk from the Chinese theatre, and the security of the motel is not good. Door left wide open in the middle of the night, giving anyone access to all of the motel room doors. Walls are very thin so you can hear everything from upstairs and next door, and lots of people shouting all through the night! Definitely spend a little extra to stay closer to hollywood/vine or hollywood/highland!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: One of many stays at Hollywood Stars
column11: We have stayed elsewhere on our many trips to tthe United States, from Brasil, and keep returning to Hollywood Stars. Management is always friendly and not fussy about early checkins, if rooms are available. And even though we were left with no choice but a smoking room for our first night in LA on a busy Halloween weekend, there was not a trace of foul smell in the room. We actually stayed in the room although they offered to change us the next morning. For the price and free parking ( our old hotel charges $15 per night which quickly adds up on our two week stays ) many quick food options within walking distance and a drug store on the corner you really cannot beat the value. Again, because it is so economical, you might find guests with loud children or less than mannered guests who scream and laugh outside your door, but that is not often and easily forgiven for the extra money we take shopping. Thanks Hollywood Stars for keeping up the good work.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: It is true that the rooms here are a little on the dated side though they are well appointed with a big fridge and great bathroom. The staff are very good and the location brilliant. A short walk to the train a long walk to the Hollywood Walk of Fame and supermarket and food options at the door stop including a taco truck at night.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I travel to Los Angeles on a frequent basis and was looking for an inexpensive way to stay. Great place for the money, the only downside is that it is in a fairly seedy part of town and the parking is tight. The staff was very friendly and the room was large and well appointed. Will definitely stay again!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: Best place to stay within the price range
column11: Pros:  Good location, 40 minutes walk to Dolby Theater;  Room is old but clean, with fridge, LCD TV    Cons:  Building is old;  Parking is difficult;  Absolutely no view whatsoever    Anyway, still a good choice if your budget is limited.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Booked for. 3 nights. The housekeeper and one of the front desk people were very nice. The room was very large. This place is in a very seedy neighborhood. Sirens all night. I never spend a lot of time so dont care about the decor. However this room was pretty bad. The walls had stains, the curtains had stains and were ripped. No screens on the window. The worst was the bathroom. Although the housekeeper did her best there were cigarette burns all over the sick and toilet. The bottwn of the tub was, well I wont even go there I would give this place one star but the housekeeper was so nice I gave two. The hall ways were clean and nice. There is about 24-26 rooms and 9 parking spots. Just so you know. The guy at the desk said most of the guests who stay there dont have cars so more spots arent needed. I pulled in and took the bus so i wont lose rhe spot. In the morning all spot were taken. What happens if he gets a lot of people with cars? This is a questionable hotel. Im not being mean just honest. Ive been in old places and didnt complain but there are limits. Dont take children here. Maybe it was just my room

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: I like this place & will stay again
column11: I was so glad when I found out I could cross the street to a 24/7 McDonald's (came in handy) as well as to a huge 24/7 grocery store across the street, which meant we didn't have to lug drinks for a mile to fill up our room refrigerator. I wasn't used to the city sounds, however, that is all over Hollywood and when we closed our windows it cut most of it out. The staff was very friendly and the maids were protective of our belongings when cleaning the room, which was nice. We only had to walk a couple of minutes from our room and we were already at the Metro subway train station which was great for Hollywood and downtown and Universal Studios quick access. Our room was shockingly large, decorated nicely, and very clean. The flat screen TV had a zillion HD channels... very nice indeed! The bathroom looked brand new and there were also wooden shutters to further block out light and sound of the city, which was nice for daytime naps. As I said, I like this place and will stay again. Highly recommended and economical (great value to dollar ratio, so to speak in me and my friends' opinion).

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Nice location , cheap and big room. Hot water, parking. Pharmacy ,supermarket and stores crossing the street. It's a place to sleep and explore the city. Not fancy . TV did not work but not a big deal for us.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Very good location for a Hollywood tourist. The room was very clean, large and had a fridge, table with chairs, nice desk, mirror and chest of drawers. Their TV and cable was very good. I did have to see the office peeps a couple times about the Wi-Fi, but they were always pleasant and accommodating. I could hear my neighbors through the wall but it was only a problem one night out of four. The parking area was small, well lite but always had a space open for me. The hallways often smelled of garlic or curry being prepared. The owners and their extended family appear to live on the first floor. I enjoyed my stay. Don't care about the negative reviews, I plan to stay there again on my next trip. More room for me.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Although it looks clean it had a funny smell throughout the hotel!?  Room was ok and reasonably roomy.  Shops next door and across were very convenient.  Some restaurants around but I wouldn't walk to far from the hotel.  Parking was a pain if you came in later in afternoon or evening! ...there isn't enough spaces so you park behind other cars and either get woken when you need to move your car or you leave car keys with staff to move it for you!??

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We stayed here for 6 nights and were satisfied.    The room was very spacious. It had a lot of room to put our stuff away, I usually have issues where tu put all my clothes and other necessities but here the room had a desk with a bench, a table with two chairs, a big shelf and a nightstand on each side of the bed. The room and bathroom were both clean and the towels were changed every day. The room actually looks better than the pictures on the hotels website. We also liked the fact that it had a fridge.  The receptionist was friendly and helpful.    We also liked the location of the hotel, it was across the street of a supermarket, that was opened from 6 a.m. - 2 a.m. and where we went every morning to get some breakfast.    The downsides:  - the Wi-fi is a bit slower than we are used to but it works a bit faster in the mornings;  - the parking lot can get a bit crowded, since it's not a really big one but we always managed to get a free parking space    All in all, we were satisfied with our stay and would go there again.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: My Sunset Hotel ( The Hollywood Starr's Hotel)
column11: I love this hotel ! Nice ppl and friendly and helpful always ready to help. I really didn't see them much cuz I was gone all day..lol, but it was quite at nite and in the day time.  I will be staying again at this place ,I told the manager this ... I'm booking ahead of time.. thinking bout L.A. in the fall !

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: You get what you pay for
column11: We stayed here for 5 nights and had never been to Hollywood before so we didn't know the exact location of this place but it said on their website that it was right next to the Chinese theatre, unfortunatally that's not true, it's about 20 minutes in a taxi or an hour walk. The rooms were big enough for the two of us, pretty standard bar fridge, TV, air con. The bed was ok, except for the discusting blanket on it which made us itchy so we didn't use it. The towels were thin but were changed daily. The free breakfast is tea and coffee making facilities and some light pastries at the reception area, not a sit down meal just something quick to grab on your way out. They have a free car park which is hard to get into because of the narrow drive way and there is about 6 car spots. We had free wifi but the card kept expiring so we had to get a new password almost every day. Our room keys didn't work most of the time so we had to get them replaced almost twice a day but there's always someone at the front desk so that was fine. The front and back door is open 24/7 so anyone off the street can walk in at any time, that might  explain the bullet proof glass at reception. There's a soft drink and ice machine which only accepts $5 bills. Overall we were not looking for 5 star because of our budget and you get what you pay for so I can't say too much more. We won't stay here again, it's worth while spending a little extra and staying closer to Hollywood strip and somewhere with more security. (No safe in room)

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: It had been my first time in the LA borough, the savoir-faire was an eyeful as well as noteworthy.    The good  It's an affordable expense, if you estimate ahead like I schemed, if your single. The room is orderly and leeway with a compartment of space, it's also has a fridge in case you diside to go grocery shopping.    The bad  It's in the west part of the strip, the area is befoul and there's a lot of shady, creepy as well as bizarre community.  If you yearn to be in the action, go to the east part of the strip, on Expedia where I booked my room, said there was complementary breakfast, I didn't see any, poor advertisement on there part. The fridge had food from the last guest who stayed there.  If you take a cab, it's an hour from here and back to LAX, the fair is around 80 buck's with tip.    Overall  You can't challenge the expense of the roadhouse, you should book as a decisive option.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: For young people it is the perfect place. It is located one metro stop from the Walk of Fame. The room was large and clean. I was satisfied with everything except breakfast. Breakfast was very poor. Only coffee to the plastic cup and some (not so good looked) wrapped pastries.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: Good value if you on a budget
column11: This was one of the cheapest motel we find in Hollywood (114$ for a double room for 2 nights). Room was really big and clean! Location was very convenient (5 minutes walk from subway) and they have a small free parking and very good free wifi. Breakfast is really poor (some cakes and coffee at the reception so don't consider it as a true breakfast). the owner and his wife were really helpful and kind. moreover the wife prepared us a delightful masala chai (they're from India) !!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: all in all a good choice
column11: good location to start sightseeing. not a noisy as you would think. shops and restaurants near by. room rates were ok. although the room smelled a bit funny, it was clean - we did not mind the cookie in the aircondition. ;-) the continental breakfast - tiny cinnamon roll and not so bad coffee in a styropor cup -matched our expectations. parking lot fits small to medium cars best.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: It was ok for the money
column11: 2 of us stayed - wanted cheap and cheerful. So wasn't expecting luxury for the money. Was resonably clean. Staff helpful enough.Close to where we wanted to go, sights, etc. Not the best area, however 2 girls on our own - didn't feel unsafe! Was ok...great location.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: This was one of the cheapest we could find in Hollywood so we weren't expecting much but we were pleasantly surprised. Room was really big! Location was very convenient and they have free parking and wifi. There was a bit of noise from the street but that's Sunset Blvd!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: The four of us [2 Adults and 2 Early teenagers] were here from the 14th to 17 July 2012. The room and bath were clean, the price very reasonable and the manager [Sheila Patel] very helpful. They kept our luggage for us while we spent a night at another hotel near Disneyland and allowed us an early check-in when we returned to LA]. They even treated my wife and boys to a special Indian-style tea which was much appreciated.  They have apparently improved since the last reviews here and so I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants value for money and does not have sky-high Hilton-esque expectations.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Only positive thing about this place is that the manager agreed to cancel our 4night stay after 1 night and refund the money.    The rooms are awful, the hallway smells really strange, so rooms worse. The sink and toilet was rusty, the back entrence doesn't have a door, so anyone can just walk in the hallway.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: We stayed here for one night back in the summer of 2010, and it was not pleasant! Anyone could walk in at any time. The rooms were dark and dirty and the beds weren't inviting... Only positive about this hotel was the price and location!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: STAY AWAY - the WORST place I've EVER stayed in!!!!
column11: TRUST ME! DO NOT STAY HERE!! It was the biggest dive I've ever been too and was full of very suspicious characters. I was really scared and actually cried when I made it out of there alive.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: My husband and I have stayed in this hotel on 3 seperate occasions and we love it! The location is good,near to all of the hollywood attractions with a walgreens next door and macdonalds over the road. The carpark is quite small but we have never had any problems finding a space. The staff are really friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and huge for the price. Would always stay here when visiting the area.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: Our bed sheet only covered top half of the mattress. No ventilation so everyone someone takes a shower, the whole place gets really humid. Lock didn't work properly. Also, breakfast was just packaged danish bread with coffee (small Styrofoam cups). Wireless was unstable. Too sketchy. Never going back.    On our 2nd night we were awaken by the police sirens from the plaza across.    At least the guy at the front was nice.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I guess it's never a great sign when you arrive to find your hotel room door propped open and all the windows in the room open too.  However it was New Years Eve and we were having to get what we were given.    The hotel staff and service were great and the location is perfect but the smell in the room was unbearable.  After a while we thought it had gone and so shut the windows and got ready to go out.  When we returned after our night out we almost gagged when we unlocked the door - it smelt very strongly of cat pee.    Perhaps we were unlucky with the room but I wouldn't take the risk of staying here again.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: Not the nicest rooms, but very helpful staff
column11: We arrived here in the middle of the night and I have to say it was pretty scary at night. However, we realized in the morning that it was not in as bad a location as we thought, however we did have a 7 minute walk or so to the metro which we needed to catch in order to get annywhere pretty much. The room was not impressive. It was big, and we were put in a smoking room despite having asked for non-smoking. It smelled awfully of cigarettes and the bed was full of burn marks and holes and the sink and toilet in the bathroom also had burn marks. The next day we were moved into a non-smoking room which was a lot better. It didn't smell so bad and didn't have burn marks everywhere. However, I still didn't feel completely secure in this hotel. The staff, however, were really friendly and helpful and were always giving us directions. They even helped us figure out how to get to Anaheim. It was a family-run business and they allowed us to leave our bags in their room after we checked out so that we could continue exploring LA. Overall, i think if you're on a budget, this isn't an awful place to stay as long as you insist you get a non-smoking room if you are a non-smoker. It is difficult to find somewhere affordable that is closer to the sites and the metro is pretty easy to navigate.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: Amazing value, amazing staff, amazing place!
column11: Myself and my fiancee stayed here in the middle of April. Could not have asked for better service. We arrived pretty late, about 12am. Our room was still available, we checked in with no bother and had an amazing nights sleep. Room was huge, king size double bed, 2 bedside tables and 2 dressers. Huge bathroom, outstanding shower and bath combo. We booked a bus tour of LA the next day through the owners and instead of letting us walk, the owner gave us a ride to where the pickup point was.    We were initially supposed to fly out around 11pm the following night; instead of carrying our bags round all day, we were allowed to leave them in the owner's living area. This was a great help. To cut a long story short, our tickets had been cancelled. After a quick phone call, we arrived back at 2am. No issues at all; shown back to our room and told we could stay as long as we needed to until our flight was sorted. Owners gave us directions on how to go and pick up our re-issued tickets.    Really cannot recommend this hotel enough. Had the owners not been so accommodating, friendly and helpful, we would have been in serious difficulties. Enjoyed our stay here immensely and would not hesitate to book again.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: Played count the sirens - Dirty, dark, pricey!
column11: Stayed here so that we could see around hollywood, which i never knew beforehand was such a hole! The place was terrible but it was Labor Day and we didnt have much other options. Charge was 170ish dollars with tax, and the room, while very big, had bugs and was dirty as well. The curtains were broken and i had to fix them to close them, as the window looked out at the alley. Chose not to allow room service in as it just seemed like a really dodgy area, and was quite scary experience. Free internet was nice though, and the shower was excellent, but it does not make up for it! Would never recommend anyone to stay here ever ever ever. Get out of hollywood!

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: After reading these reviews i was scared to stay here but i have to say im impressed!
column11: Ok so after the rooms had been booked i came across these reviews and was really put off though i decided to try it out anyway and if there were any problems sort it out when we got here.    Ive stayed here a month and didn't have any problems except in the last week when the toilet wouldnt work the manager gave us a plunger and left us to deal with it ourselves....so yeh the service could be better. Other than that, there are a couple of beggers around the area though we walked to and from the metro underground station (around the corner) late every night without anyone bothering us.    Im impressed by the cleanliness and size of the room aswell a lot of these reviews say they aren't clean and have bugs...this is not true! Another thing that has come up a lot is the noise at the hotel, up until the last week I didn't hear anybody else in the other rooms though one night in that last week there were a few noisy people in the hallway though after about 20 minutes I couldn't hear them again.    Its a pretty good area seen as the metro station around the corner can get you to most places. I would say this hotel is ideal for travellers on a budget, im pretty fussy when it comes to hotels and I actually liked this one. The transport is close by, big rooms, clean rooms. The only problem is the service but you shouldnt really get any problems to ask them about. Oh and breakfast is coffe and a pastry thing so i decided to skip that but my dad seemed to like them. The free wifi is good too and theres free parking at the back

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I stayed in Hollywood Star Inn couple of nights with my friends. I have to say for the first time in my life I was really scared.  When we arrived to the Star Inn, the place looked really dodgy, the doors to the street n backyard were fully open. When we were checking in, a shemale walked in and asked us for money. column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: You get what you pay for
column11: We were on a budget while in LA so the price suited but on arriving at the hotel we waited to check in behind a couple who had arrived, viewed their room and decided to leave. The hotel is cheap and I have seen worse area's of LA but I did feel quite unsafe while staying there mainly due to some of the dodgy looking guests. The front and back entrace to the hotel/motel are left wide open meaning anyone could walk in if and when they wanted to and the desk isn't manned 24hrs so the rooms are quite exposed. My friend and I ended up putting our suitcases across the door at night when we went to bed for extra security. The room itself was large enough and the cleanliness was okay, my one gripe was the sheet was too small for the bed so you would end up having the bare mattress underneath you during the night which was pretty gross.    One a positive the location of the hotel is not too bad, close to Universal, Hollywood Bowl and so on. It also has a free car park at the back.    I think if you are maybe a guy or a group of males not wanting to spend much then this would be okay for you but I really wouldn't recommend it to females staying on their own or anyone with kids. It just felt too unsafe.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: Dodgy area, but surprisingly good rooms
column11: A group of 10 of us stayed here for one night.    This hotel is in a fairly rough area of Hollywood, but once we got inside we were impressed by the size and cleanliness of the rooms. The hotel has its own parking as well.    It was only a short drive to Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Griffith Observatory, and then we spent the evening in a wonderful dive bar just around the corner (I think it was called the White Horse).    Recommended if you're looking for a bargain.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: I was really nervous about staying in Hollywood proper (single woman travelling alone) and didn't have a lot of time to research hotels. So, I'd say I took a gamble on the Hollywood Star and I'm glad I did!    I'll say that I don't need '4 star' establishments when I travel. I just want something clean, quiet, and well-located. This hotel fit the bill and more.    Specific points worth mentioning:    Parking--I was grateful for free parking near all the major Hollywood landmarks (some would call it a hike, but I like walking). I planned to stay in Hollywood until 4PM the afternoon of the day I checked out and asked the clerk if I could leave my car at the hotel. She just asked me how long and said 'no problem.'    The room--Could have used some sprucing up, but it was clean and I was thrilled to have a refrigerator.    The bathroom--WOW. It had obviously been redone very recently and was absolutely spotless and beautiful. It didn't even seem to fit the style of the hotel. Major points for this.    The location--the Hollywood sights were several blocks away (walking distance for me) so some might not like that. There are tons of fastfood restaurants around the hotel (including a Denny's). I walked back to my hotel one night *after sundown* and felt safe.    If I had to go back to Hollywood, I'd stay here again.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column11: The stay in Hollywood Star Inn it is not so bad. The room was large and the bathroom was clean though towels were not enough for two people. Regarding parking when we arrived there were some injured cars in the parking behind the building and we were little afraid to leave the car here, but when we went back in the night the cars were disappear and the parking looks like safe and that's exactly as it was. The second one with the room's key. The key often became demagnetized so we were forced to go to the reception where there ever was nobody and we had to wait.  The location it is not so bad, you are just three Km from Chinese theater. If you want to visit the Universal Studios and the Warner Bros I suggest this place, obviously you have to get a car. If you want to go to the beach it is not a good place for you.

column1: 5435 W Sunset Blvd Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90027
column10: You get what you pay for
column11: Let me start by saying that this is not the worst hotel I've stayed in. The location is a little removed from the main attractions. Basically you will see the local population...and not the upper crust, either. It's not the ghetto, it's just not very glamorous.    The first room we were shown had a funny smell. The room we took was quite large and pretty clean, although there was a couch in there that was horribly stained and I really didn't want to know what went on on it. The sheets were clean but didn't quite fit and were not neatly tucked. Considering the size of the room, it was surprising that there was no closet. The bathroom was pretty clean, but the tub could have used a more thorough scrubbing along the bottom and the toilet lid looked as if it hadn't been cleaned in years (but at least the toilet itself was clean). The towels were clean but old and worn (and I wondered whether they could spare more than the 2 they left).    Now, for the good part. The first clue that this place was not for me was the bullet-proof glass covering the front desk and the fact that they wanted to copy my driver's license. Once the motorcycle gangs passed outside, we finally fell asleep only to awaken in the middle of the night by aggressive yelling by a man in the next room followed by the screams of a woman.    We checked out the next morning and went to stay with a friend. Consider that for what it's worth.
